results.title: KLF2-dependent transcriptional regulation safeguards the heart against pathological hypertrophy.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: This study provides the first evidence that transcription factor @GENE_KLF2 @GENE_10365 @@@KLF2@@@ serves as a negative regulator of @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomegaly</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006332 @@@cardiac hypertrophy@@@. Our findings highlight the therapeutic potential of enhancing @GENE_KLF2 @GENE_10365 @@@KLF2@@@ expression, particularly through @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ administration, as a promising strategy in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomegaly</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006332 @@@cardiac hypertrophy@@@.

results.title: Simvastatin Improves Cardiac Hypertrophy in Diabetic Rats by Attenuation of Oxidative Stress and Inflammation Induced by Calpain-1-Mediated Activation of Nuclear Factor-kappaB (NF-kappaB)
results.text_hl: These results suggest that the mechanism underlying the attenuation of @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomegaly</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006332 @@@cardiac hypertrophy@@@ by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ is related to inhibition of NF-kappaB nuclear translocation by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.
